intro: Synaphea constricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf synaphea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Synaphea constricta is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
